thread.title: Flip Saunders Dies Of Cancer; Reactions From Minnesota Timberwolves, NBA
thread.title_full: Flip Saunders Dies Of Cancer; Reactions From Minnesota Timberwolves, NBA

author: Shawn Rice
title: Flip Saunders Dies Of Cancer; Reactions From Minnesota Timberwolves, NBA
text:
Flip Saunders Dies Of Cancer; Reactions From Minnesota Timberwolves, NBA 1 SHARE October 25, 2015 Sports 0 
In sad news, Flip Saunders, longtime coach of the Minnesota Timberwolves, passed away on Sunday at the age of 60. The Wolves president was diagnosed with Hodgkin’s Lymphoma earlier in 2015. The Timberwolves announced the news in a statement: It is with extreme sadness to report that today Phil “Flip” Saunders has passed away at age 60. pic.twitter.com/l8tthTocAt 
— Timberwolves PR (@Twolves_PR) October 25, 2015 
Saunders coached 17 years in the NBA, joining the head ranks partway through 1995-96 in Kevin Garnett’s rookie season. The University of Minnesota graduate native paired with Garnett to make the playoffs in all but one of his full seasons with the 7-footer, earning his conference’s best record in 2003-04, according to Yahoo . 
His NBA teams won 50 or more games on seven occasions, including a Pistons franchise-record 64 victories in 2005-06. Twice he coached in the All-Star Game, and he led Team USA to the gold medal in the Goodwill Games in 2001. He also spent time as an analyst at ESPN, said the network . 
Saunders is survived by a wife and four children, including son Ryan, who is a Wolves assistant coach. 
Here are reactions from Twitter: Flip you were one of a kind. Great basketball mind and even better human being. You had a great… https://t.co/W84KYPitsx 
— Kevin Love (@kevinlove) October 25, 2015 My condolences to the Saunders and @Timberwolves family! Lost a great person in our fraternity way to early. So sad #RIPFlip 
— LeBron James (@KingJames) October 25, 2015 Thinking back to this story makes me feel like Flip Saunders got a bonus 8 years of life: https://t.co/JJjP3wxC9d 
— J.A. Adande (@jadande) October 25, 2015 In memory of Flip Saunders, this from @SteveRushin : https://t.co/qywRLekTRj 
— Richard Deitsch (@richarddeitsch) October 25, 2015 Just heard the news of Flip Saunders passing. Awful. Just awful. Respect to a MN legend. 
— Nick Swardson (@NickSwardson) October 25, 2015 RIP to @Flip_Saunders … Had the pleasure to play for him and get to know him. Great coach and Person!!! My heart goes out to his family 
— Baron Davis (@Baron_Davis) October 25, 2015 In a world where I don't like a lot of people, Flip Saunders was actually a person that I liked. Gone way too soon. May he rest in peace. 
— Skip Bayless (@FunSkipBayless) October 25, 2015 Horrible news about Flip Saunders passing away. One of my favorite coaches that I covered. 
— Mike Wells (@MikeWellsNFL) October 25, 2015 RIP Coach Flip Saunders 
— Terrence Ross (@T_DotFlight31) October 25, 2015 Wow! Just heard that Flip Saunders passed away. RIP to our NBA family member…gone too soon. #prayersUp #RIPFlip 
— Anthony Tolliver (@ATolliver44) October 25, 2015 The best coach in franchise history most wins and playoff appearances.Flip Saunders was a good man-Flip was my friend this really hurts. 
— Larry Fitzgerald Sr. (@FitzBeatSr) October 25, 2015 Such sad news about Flip Saunders. Our thoughts and prayers are with his family. 
— Richard Pitino (@MNCoachPitino) October 25, 2015 Very sad to hear the news of Coach Flip Saunders. Prayers for his family and @Timberwolves organization. The league lost a great man. 
— Sam Dekker (@dekker) October 25, 2015 I worked w Flip Saunders briefly. He was professional, enthusiastic, and eager to teach the game to others. RIP Coach. #Timberwolves 
— Robert Flores (@RoFloESPN) October 25, 2015 Sad. " @FOXSportsLive : JUST IN: Timberwolves Head Coach Flip Saunders has died at the age of 60. (via @Twolves_PR ) pic.twitter.com/ii0DIx4rFW "
